page.title: 16Mill Farm, Horningsham
page.content: The farm has 74 hectares(186 acres) of land and is situated in the heart of the Village. The farm is very prosperous and concentrates on beef cattle and sheep. The beef cattle are fattened up on silage and hay before being taken to market. The sheep are put out to graze and are sheared once a year at the beginning of the Summer. Eigth weeks before lambing they are fed on 'sheep cake'. Wheat and barley are grown each year and much land is given over to hay making which is stored for the Winter. The farm got its name because corn used to be ground there although the mill wheel has now disappeared although the mill race is still there; the cog-room has be turned into a living room. The building dates from the sixteenth century.
